title: Aluminum Hits 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,876.15 per tonne on October 27, 2025, marking a 0.57% daily increase and a 7.35% gain over the past month. The surge is attributed to tightening supply, especially due to China's aluminum output cap, with prices reaching their highest level in three years.

title: LME aluminium cash price rises to $2,878.5/t on October 27 as stocks dip to 469,275t
summary: LME aluminum prices climbed to $2,878.5 per tonne on October 27, driven by firm demand and a 3,850-tonne drop in exchange stocks to 469,275 tonnes. The price increase reflects ongoing tightness in the physical aluminum market.

title: SMM Flash: Secondary Aluminum Ingot Social Inventory Dips on Oct 28
summary: Secondary aluminum alloy ingot inventories have declined, with prices expected to remain firm in the short term due to strong cost support and a tight supply-demand balance. The market outlook suggests continued price resilience for ADC12 aluminum alloy ingots.

title: Australia's largest aluminum smelter could close, says Rio Tinto
summary: Rio Tinto announced that Australia's largest aluminum smelter, Tomago, may shut down in 2028 due to rising electricity costs, with power making up over 40% of operating expenses. The company has begun consultations with employees, as both coal and renewable energy options are expected to become unaffordable after the current power contract expires.

title: Rio Tinto flags uncertain future at Australiaâ€™s largest aluminum smelter
summary: Rio Tinto warned that the Tomago smelter, Australia's largest, faces closure after 2028 as it struggles to secure commercially viable power contracts. The smelter, a major power user in New South Wales, is emblematic of challenges facing energy-intensive industries amid Australia's transition to renewables.

title: Operating Rate of Aluminum Processing Slightly Declined to 62.4%
summary: China's downstream aluminum processing operating rate dipped slightly to 62.4%, with primary aluminum alloy production stable but aluminum plate/sheet and strip rates falling due to funding pressures and declining orders in some sectors. Demand is expected to weaken further as the peak season ends.

title: Aluminium Industry Unites at Climate Week NYC to Showcase Circularity as a Climate Solution
summary: At Climate Week NYC 2025, the Global Beverage Can Circularity Alliance highlighted aluminum beverage cans' role in the low-carbon circular economy. The event showcased new circularity data, high-impact recycling technologies, and policy recommendations to scale can-to-can-loop recycling, emphasizing aluminum's high recyclability and energy savings.

title: Key takeaways from AICE 2025 SMM (14th) aluminium industry annual conference
summary: The conference discussed China's 'dual carbon' goals impacting the aluminum industry with stricter energy and emission limits. Innovations like anode surface coating technology reduce carbon electrode consumption and emissions, while new roasting technologies for red mud were analyzed for energy efficiency and environmental impact.

title: Tomago Aluminium Faces Closure Due to Rising Energy Costs
summary: Tomago Aluminium in Australia is facing potential closure from rising energy costs. The article details technological innovations such as prebaked anode technology, advanced process controls, and inert anode research that could reduce energy consumption by up to 20%, though significant investment is required to implement these solutions.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers
summary: Phinergy's aluminum-air backup energy solution was selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub from over 70 proposals to scale to megawatt levels for data centers. This technology aims to replace diesel backup generators, supporting the transition to net-zero operations in digital infrastructure.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
summary: The ALUMINIUM 2026 event will focus on sustainability with an emphasis on secondary aluminum use for decarbonization. The event will feature innovations in metal processing, recycling, automation, and cross-sector applications, aiming to foster collaboration and showcase solutions for industry challenges.

title: Alcast Company Advances the Future of Precision Aluminum Casting
summary: Alcast Company integrates environmentally conscious practices in precision aluminum casting to minimize waste and maximize material efficiency. The company offers comprehensive services including machining and finishing, supporting sustainable production aligned with modern standards.

title: Local Chinese Rebar Prices Down 2.3 Percent in Mid-October 2025
summary: In mid-October 2025, the average price of 20 mm HRB 400E rebar in China decreased by 2.3% to RMB 3,110.5/mt. Other steel products like wire rod, medium steel plate, hot rolled coil, seamless steel pipes, and angles also saw price reductions. This reflects a general downward trend in Chinese steel prices during that period.

title: Global Steel Markets Show Limited Price Fluctuations
summary: Global steel markets experienced minimal price changes during the fourth week of October 2025. This stability suggests a period of price equilibrium in the global steel market. The report highlights the lack of significant fluctuations in steel prices worldwide.

title: Iron Ore Extends Gains on Proposal to Constrain China's Steel Supply
summary: Iron ore prices have increased due to a new proposal aimed at limiting China's steel supply. This development could impact global steel production and prices. The proposal's effects on the steel market are being closely monitored.

title: US Raw Steel Production Sees Slight Increase
summary: US raw steel production increased by 0.2% for the week ending October 25, 2025, reaching 1.747 million net tons. This represents a 9.9% increase from the same period last year. The capacity utilization rate was 76.3%.

title: Global Steel Demand Outlook for 2025 and 2026
summary: The World Steel Association projects global steel demand to remain flat in 2025 at about 1,749 million tonnes, with a modest rebound of 1.3% expected in 2026. Growth in 2026 will be driven by trends in developing economies and a recovery in Europe. US steel demand is expected to grow by 1.8% in both 2025 and 2026.

title: Nigeria's Steel Development Transformation
summary: Nigeria aims to transform its steel sector with ambitious production targets, including achieving 10 million tonnes of annual liquid steel production by 2030. This involves significant investment in infrastructure and utilizing local iron ore reserves to reduce import dependency.

title: Metso to Supply Advanced Iron Ore Sintering Plant to India
summary: Metso is delivering an advanced iron ore sintering plant to India, integrating emission-optimized sintering technology to enhance sustainability and production efficiency. This technology reduces CO2 emissions by over 54,000 tonnes annually and optimizes fuel consumption. The plant will contribute to regional economic growth and diversification.

title: Omani Green Iron to Revive British Steel Industry
summary: Meranti Green Steel plans to produce low-carbon Hot Briquetted Iron (HBI) in Oman using green hydrogen and natural gas. This will help the UK transition away from outdated blast furnaces and secure a reliable supply chain for clean iron, aligning with global trends towards low-carbon steel.

title: Utility and Seongnam City Sign H2Gen Hydrogen Demonstration and Certification Project
summary: Utility and Seongnam City have partnered on a hydrogen demonstration project using H2Gen technology, which produces low-carbon hydrogen from industrial off-gases. This project aims to decarbonize industrial sectors in Korea, starting with heavy mobility.

title: Signals of Change â€“ October 2025
summary: Microsoft has signed a deal for green hydrogen-based steel from Stegra, highlighting the growing momentum in clean industrial materials. This move supports the transition to clean energy solutions and decarbonization efforts in the steel industry.

title: Copper price nears record on trade deal boost, supply woes
summary: Copper prices surged toward a record as optimism grows over an imminent US-China trade deal, boosting demand outlook amid supply disruptions at major mines in Congo, Chile, and Indonesia. The International Copper Study Group cut its 2025 mine supply forecast due to these disruptions, while demand is expected to rise significantly by 2050 driven by energy transition needs.

title: Argentina's Mining Sector Receives US Investment, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated overnight, closing slightly higher at $11,000.5/mt amid trading volume of 25,000 lots. Argentina received about $20 billion in US support to promote mining projects including copper, aiming to boost foreign investment and infrastructure, though political and economic stability remain critical for sustained recovery.

title: Copper Nears Record High on Trade Deal Hopes
summary: Copper prices surged close to record highs driven by optimism over a US-China trade agreement and supply disruptions at major mines worldwide. The metal has gained 25% this year, recovering from previous trade tension impacts, with demand expected to rise sharply due to electrification and energy transition needs.

title: Copper Rises as Risk Appetite Improves
summary: Copper futures climbed above $5 per pound, reaching the highest level since July 2025, supported by easing US-China trade tensions and expectations of US Federal Reserve rate cuts. Supply disruptions at major mines and increased Chinese smelter shipments also influenced the market.

title: Oil Prices Stabilize, Copper Prices Rise, Gold Falls Below $4,000
summary: LME copper futures rose 0.61% to settle at $11,029 per ton, nearing historical highs due to ongoing supply disruptions at major mines. The rally is supported by supply constraints and strong demand outlook amid global energy transition efforts.

title: Copper hits 17-month peak on US-China trade deal optimism
summary: Copper prices reached a 17-month peak driven by optimism about a US-China trade deal, reflecting improved market sentiment and supply concerns. The metal's price strength is linked to expectations of increased demand and constrained supply.

title: Copper prices edge higher as US-China trade optimism lingers
summary: Copper prices on the Shanghai Futures Exchange rose slightly by 0.18% to 88,100 yuan per metric ton, supported by ongoing optimism about a US-China trade agreement and supply disruptions.

title: Copper Prices Reach 16-Month High: Effects of the Trade Agreement
summary: Copper prices hit a 16-month high fueled by optimism surrounding the US-China trade agreement, which also positively impacted other metals. The trade deal outlook is a key driver behind the recent price surge.

title: Copper price nears record on trade deal boost, supply woes
summary: Copper prices surged toward a record as optimism over a potential US-China trade deal and ongoing supply disruptions at major mines drove the rally. The International Copper Study Group has cut its 2025 mine supply growth forecast to 1.4% due to recent incidents at key mines in Congo, Chile, and Indonesia, raising concerns about meeting future demand amid the global energy transition.

title: Argentina's Mining Sector Receives US Investment, LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Higher Overnight [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: Argentina received about $20 billion in US support to promote mining projects in lithium, copper, and energy, aiming to boost foreign exchange reserves and attract more investment. Meanwhile, LME copper prices opened higher, fluctuated, and closed up 0.49%, reflecting ongoing market volatility and investor interest in copper amid global supply concerns.

title: Copper Nears Record High on Trade Deal Hopes
summary: Copper prices are approaching record highs, buoyed by optimism over a potential US-China trade deal and persistent supply disruptions at major mines in Chile, Congo, and Indonesia. The metal has gained 25% this year, with investors focused on the delicate balance between rising demand for electrification and constrained production capacity.

title: Copper to hold gains in 2026 as mine disruptions fuel deficit
summary: Analysts have raised their 2026 copper price forecasts due to ongoing mine disruptions, with the LME cash copper contract expected to average $10,500 per metric ton. Recent incidents, including the suspension of operations at Indonesia's Grasberg mine, have shifted market expectations from a surplus to a deficit in 2025, though new mine ramps could eventually ease supply pressures.

title: Harmony Gold Acquires MAC Copper for $1.01 Billion Deal
summary: Harmony Gold has acquired MAC Copper for $1.01 billion, reflecting a strategic shift by gold miners to expand into copper production amid surging demand for electrification metals. The move highlights the industry's response to projections that copper demand will rise 70% by 2040, driven by renewable energy and electric vehicle adoption.

title: A Copper Mine In The Desert Could Recast Pakistan's Future â€“ OpEd
summary: The Reko Diq copper and gold project in Pakistan, one of the world's largest untapped mineral deposits, is moving forward again this month. The development could significantly impact Pakistan's economy and global copper supply, though the article focuses more on geopolitical and economic implications than current production or capacity details.

title: Future For Copper: Powering Sustainable Innovation In 2025
summary: This article discusses the rising demand for copper driven by renewable energy and sustainable infrastructure projects, with over 60% of copper usage expected in these sectors by 2025. It highlights innovations in mining and processing, including AI-powered precision mining, hydrometallurgical processing, and urban mining through advanced recycling methods, aiming to reduce environmental impacts and meet demand sustainably.

title: Copper Demand Surges as AI and Electrification Reshape Industries
summary: The article explores how AI and electrification are driving substantial growth in global copper demand, projecting increases through 2030 and 2050. It emphasizes the role of developing economies in electrification and the investment opportunities arising from supply-demand imbalances, including the importance of recycling to meet 25-30% of future copper supply.

title: Copper to hold gains in 2026 as mine disruptions fuel deficit
summary: Analysts raised copper price forecasts for 2026 due to mine disruptions in Indonesia, Congo, and Chile causing supply concerns and market deficits. The article notes copper's price gains in 2025 and anticipates a tightening refined copper market, while also discussing new mine developments that may moderate prices.

title: The world's first electric car without metals or minerals is launched
summary: This article presents eNimon, the first electric car made without metals or minerals, highlighting the critical role of sustainable mining in meeting the material demands of green technologies. It underscores the challenges of mineral shortages for climate goals and features Sandvik's efforts to innovate sustainable mining practices.

title: Nickel prices experienced a significant decline on October 28 while nickel inventory reached a new record high
summary: Spot nickel prices in China fell sharply on October 28, with SMM #1 refined nickel trading at 120,700â€“123,600 yuan/mt, down 900 yuan/mt from the previous day, as inventories hit a record high, signaling continued weak demand and ample supply.

title: Antam 9-month profit surges 197% on strong gold and nickel sales
summary: Indonesian miner Antam reported a 197% jump in net profit for the first nine months of 2025, driven by robust sales of gold, nickel, and bauxite, alongside cost management and downstreaming efforts, despite broader nickel market weakness.

title: Nickel Industries Reports Strong September Quarter with Increased EBITDA
summary: Nickel Industries announced a strong September quarter, with adjusted EBITDA up significantly due to lower cash costs and higher sales, though mine sales were impacted by quota delays; the company also highlighted progress on new projects and ESG achievements.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Nornickel, Russiaâ€™s largest nickel producer, has maintained its 2025 nickel production forecast at 196,000â€“204,000 metric tons despite a 4% year-to-date decline. The company reported an 18% quarterly increase in nickel output to 54,000 metric tons in Q3, attributed to higher processing of raw materials accumulated during Q2, but cited ongoing challenges from equipment replacement and seasonal disruptions.

title: Nickel Industries Reports Strong September Quarter with Increased EBITDA
summary: Nickel Industries announced robust Q3 2025 results, with adjusted EBITDA rising to US$87 million, driven by strong performance in both RKEF and HPAL operations. The company highlighted cost reductions, increased sales, and progress on new projects, though mine sales were impacted by quota delays. Nickel Industries also emphasized its safety record and recent debt refinancing.

title: Nickel Industries Q3 EBITDA rises on strong RKEF, HPAL performance
summary: Australia-listed Nickel Industries Ltd reported another solid quarterly performance, with EBITDA growth supported by strong RKEF and HPAL operations. Details are behind a paywall, but the headline confirms continued operational strength in Indonesian nickel production.

summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report, highlighting that 94% of its energy comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its strategy and reports ongoing progress in reducing its environmental impact.

date: Not specified (latest update in search results)

date: Not specified (latest update in search results)

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion on the future of nuclear energy in Italy's boilermaking industry. The event highlighted the strategic role of nuclear energy in Europe's energy transition and Italy's potential to strengthen its manufacturing base. Tenaris's mill in Italy recently obtained accreditation to supply materials for nuclear facilities.

title: Tenaris signs agreement with Axpo for green energy supply to Dalmine plant
summary: Tenaris signed a Power Purchase Agreement with Axpo Italia to supply green energy to its Dalmine seamless steel tube factory. This agreement supports Tenaris's commitment to renewable energy sources.

title: Prysmian Gets EUR 45 Billion from EIB to Promote Energy
summary: Prysmian has signed a finance contract worth EUR 45 billion with the European Investment Bank (EIB) to enhance electricity transmission and distribution in Europe. The investment will help Prysmian double its production capacity for extruded cables at its factories in Finland, Italy, and France. This project supports EU targets for clean energy transmission via submarine cable solutions.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender for the construction of the submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The project aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security and supporting the shift towards cleaner energy.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Prysmian, the world's largest cable maker, views the proposed US copper tariff as an opportunity. The company believes it can benefit from the tariff due to its vertically integrated copper operation in the U.S. This includes sourcing raw copper from a mine in Arizona and operating a copper rod mill in Texas.
